qas.question: How many metric tons of bananas and copra does Samoa produce each year?
What pest is the greatest threat to Samoan crops?
Are the cocoa beans grown in Samoa high or low quality?
What company produces more coffee than any other in Samoa?

plausible_answers.text: in the range of 13,000 to 15,000 metric tons

qas.question: In how many tons is the annual production of coffee?

plausible_answers.text: Samoa could produce in excess of 40,000 metric tons (44,000 short tons) of copra

qas.question: What would happen if rubber wasn't produced in Samoa?
What kind of coffee plants are grown in Samoa?
What company is the largest copra producer?
What kind of impact does the export value of copra have on the economy?

context: The staple products of Samoa are copra (<a0_0>dried coconut meat<a0_0/>), cocoa bean (for chocolate), and bananas. The annual production of both bananas and copra has been <b5_0>in the range of <a1_0>13,000 to 15,000<a1_0/> metric tons<b5_0/> (about 14,500 to 16,500 short tons). If the <a2_0>rhinoceros beetle<a2_0/> in Samoa were eradicated, <b6_0>Samoa could produce in excess of 40,000 metric tons (44,000 short tons) of copra<b6_0/>. Samoan cocoa beans are of very <a3_0>high quality<a3_0/> and used in fine New Zealand chocolates. <b7_0>Most are Criollo-Forastero hybrids<b7_0/>. Coffee grows well, but production has been uneven. <a4_0><b8_0>WSTEC<b8_0/><a4_0/> is the biggest coffee producer. Rubber has been produced in Samoa for many years, but its export value has <b9_0>little impact<b9_0/> on the economy.[citation needed]
